metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3618 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: ALPACA is an application layer protocol content confusion attack,exploiting TLS servers implementing different protocols but usingcompatible certificates, such as multi-domain or wildcard certificates. AMiTM attacker having access to victim's traffic at the TCP/IP layer canredirect traffic from one subdomain to another, resulting in a valid TLSsession. This breaks the authentication of TLS and cross-protocol attacksmay be possible where the behavior of one protocol service may compromisethe other at the application layer.

criterions.comment: nginx: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
vsftpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
sendmail package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
